intro: Mascagnia hippocrateoides var. platyrachis, commonly known as the broad-leaved mascagnia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its large, broad, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping in arid environments. The species is also notable for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
